div3.head: Intent of this Success Criterion
div3.p: The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that any non-speech sounds are low enough that a user who is hard of hearing can separate the speech from background sounds or other noise foreground speech content.

The value of 20 dB was chosen based on Large area assistive listening systems (ALS): Review and recommendations and In-the-ear measurements of interference in hearing aids from digital wireless telephones

item.p: People who are hard of hearing often have great difficulty separating speech from background sound.

p.loc: Mixing audio files so that non-speech sounds are at least 20 decibels lower than the speech audio content

item.p: Providing a way for users to adjust auditory levels of foreground and background sound independently (future link)
Providing an audio track for synchronized media that includes background sounds that are at least 20 decibels lower than speech (future link)
